author: Special Correspondent
text:
Union Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has directed the Government of Puducherry to relieve T.S reekant, an IAS Officer.

He is also the Secretary to Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry immediately with a direction to join the post in New Delhi for which the transfer order was issued nearly a year ago.

Service of over 6 years

The officer belonging to AGMU(Arunachal Pradesh-Goa-Mizoram and Union Territory Cadre) has been serving in the Union Territory for six and half years.

Presently he has been serving as Secretary to Lieutenant Governor since July 17, 2014.

According to an order from the Union Ministry of Home Affairs, Mr. Sreekant was transferred from Puducherry to Government of National Capital Territory of Delhi(GNCTD) vide order dated April 8, 2015.

Thereafter through another order dated October 9 , 2015, the ministry directed that Mr. Sreekant be relieved immediately with the direction to join his new place of posting.

The present order of the MHA observed that he has not joined in his new place of posting so far.

Relieved

The order of MHA said accordingly, as desired by the competent authority, Mr. Sreekanth has been relieved and directed to join in his new place of posting immediately under intimation to the ministry.

Failure on the part of him to comply with the order will attract disciplinary action against him under relevant rules.

The MHA also said the Government of Puducherry should not draw his salary from March 2016 onwards.
title: Union Ministry directs govt. to effect transfer of IAS officer soon
